thread.title: Walker signs bill ending Doe political investigations
thread.title_full: Walker signs bill ending Doe political investigations

title: Walker signs bill ending Doe political investigations
text:
Tune in to our newscasts streaming live at the following times: 
News 3 This Morning: Weekdays 4:30 a.m.-7 a.m.News 3 at Noon: Weekdays at NoonLive at Five: Weekdays at 5 p.m.-5:30 p.m.News 3 at 5:30: Sun. at 5:30â€¦ Walker signs bill ending Doe political investigations Published On: Oct 23 2015 01:28:02 PM CDT Updated On: Oct 23 2015 01:29:09 PM CDT 
Scott Walker MADISON, Wis. - 
Gov. Scott Walker has signed into law a bill that does away with secret John Doe investigations into political misconduct. Related Content Assembly sends bill ending secret investigations to Walker 
Walker signed the bill Friday. 
Walker has been involved in two John Doe investigations, neither of which resulted in him being charged. The most recent probe involved Walker's recall campaign and conservative groups. The state Supreme Court ended the investigation in July, saying there was nothing unconstitutional about the campaign coordination. 
The Republican-controlled Legislature passed the bill doing away with John Does for any kind of political misconduct, including bribes, theft and campaign finance violations. They could still be used for violent felonies and some drug crimes. 
John Does are like a grand jury, but are done before a judge. Witnesses are under gag orders, and prosecutors can compel people to testify. 
Copyright 2015 by Associated Press.
